title: DATS dimension schema
description: A feature of an entity, i.e. an individual measurable property (both quantitative or qualitative) of the entity being observed.

name.description: The name of the dimension measured or observed during the data acquisition process, ideally from a controlled terminology.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements describing the dimension.

variable_type_option_1.description: the nature of the dimension selected from the 3 options modeled as 'enumeration', with hard coded list of possible options

variable_type_option_2.description: the nature of the dimension selected from the 3 options, with delegation to annotation_schema for provision of value and valueIRI to described the type of variable (

types.description: A term, ideally from a controlled terminology, identifying the nature of the dimension, placing it in a typology.

datatype.description: The type of data for this dimension, as described with the DataType entity.

values.description: The actual collections of values collected for that dimension.

unit.description: A reference measurement unit associated with scalar dimensions, ideally from a reference controlled terminology.

isAbout.description: A material or a dataset, which is the object of this dimension (this dimension is about the material - e.g. the heights of the patients - or the dataset - e.g. the standard deviation or the set of outliers or a quality indicator of a dataset).

partOf.description: The dataset(s) this dimension belongs to.

descriptiveStatistics.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.

extraProperties.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.
